etymologies: late 19th century. From scientific Latin Acromyodi, former group name from acro- + -myodi (in Polymyodi) + -an

definitions: Of a bird: having a syrinx whose muscles are attached to the ends of the bronchial semi-rings; specifically (in Garrod's scheme) belonging to the division Acromyodi of passerine birds, closely corresponding to the suborder Oscines (the songbirds).
